oai_dc:dc.dc:title: J.C. Napier with the Nashville Housing Authority, c.1930s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of James Carroll Napier visiting a housing project with the Nashville Housing Authority, c.1930s. Napier was a prominent African American businessman, politician, lawyer, and civil rights leader from Nashville, Tennessee. He was the first African American president of the city council, and was instrumental in founding numerous civic institutions in the city that went on to benefit the African American buisness community, with special emphasis on education. Photographed by Wiles Photographers. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Napier, J.C. 1845-1940
Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.);
